headline: WTW in talks to buy NatWest pensions unit Cushon
summary: The pensions giant WTW is in talks to buy the workplace retirement schemes platform owned by NatWest Group, the FTSE-100 lender.  Sky News has learnt that WTW - formerly known as Willis Towers Watson - has emerged as the frontrunner to buy Cushon from NatWest following an auction which attracted several leading industry names.  Cushon manages assets worth £3.7bn, according to the latest figures provided by NatWest, which bought a controlling stake in the business for £144m two years ago.
